ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
ygData.msgSnippet: I agree with an earlier response that soloing is NOT the determination of an overpowered class.  I ve lately taken to playing in groups on the weekends and
ygData.messageBody:
I agree with an earlier response that soloing is NOT the determination of an
overpowered class. I've lately taken to playing in groups on the weekends
and soloing in the mornings during the week. I have soloed (and easily I
might add) through 54, where I am now. At one point I was a twink with
overpowered equip but I dont think thats true anymore.

51-54 I've been in Burningwood :) Its very nice here.. fear kiting or dot
kiting, its up to you :)

Halana/Tani

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Christopher Sanders [mailto:christopher.sanders@...]
> Sent: Friday, August 24, 2001 6:43 AM
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
>
>
> Seems to me, we solo well for certain level ranges.
>
> First, the early levels. Next would be our first charm song.
> Next would be
> where I am now. 39, and I can solo nearly any blue or black, with
> patience, using chains and my 2 chants, with drums equipped.
> Which is nice
> when you get an add. :)
>
> In GD, it's sometimes hard to find a group, so it's nice to
> once again have
> the option of soloing until I can get one.
>
> Atonal
>
> PS - Our SK's tank Velketor. :)
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Blitz Krieg [mailto:blitz_krieg@...]
> Sent: Thursday, August 23, 2001 8:05 PM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Be very afraid....
>
>
> I'm in total agreement. I can't speak for solo play, but in
> group play we
> simply kick ass. Even on raids, with the right guild that
> knows how to use
> us, we're no slouches. Thott throws out a lot of numbers
> about how we don't
> scale well as we level, but somehow his analysis doesn't mirror my
> experiences on a daily basis.
>
> Hopefully VI is just looking at "stacking issues" and not
> anything more
> grand. :)
>
> Darkfox
> Xegony
>
>
>
> Ugh....
> Its funny... the more I play my bard and the higher she gets, I find
> myself
> sometimes not telling people everything I can do, kind of
> keeping a low
> profile, hoping that they don't notice. Seriously, don't
> laugh, its just
> that bards seem very overpowered to me at higher levels,
> then again 60
> shaman with Can IV.... I used to think all level 60 were
> equally powerful
> but I'm changing my thoughts. I hope nobody else figures this out!
>
> Tani, 54 Bardette
> Halana, 60 Shaman
> Solusek Ro
>
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
